ygData.subject: Re: Machine Learning and the Long View of AI

Andy,

I know you "take the subject matter seriously," perhaps a little too=

seriously!

When you are making accusations regarding "withholding informa=
tion" or
us being "more forthcoming in regards to the bounds of your agenda=
,"
as if we are intentionally hiding some kind of secret agenda, the
conver=
sation has unfortunately slipped off the deep end and is no
longer in the r=
ealm of rational discussion.  Sounds more like a spy
thriller to me. 

Or w=
hen you say, "NEAT has so much more potential than you have
exercised publi=
cally to date," that actually implies that we are aware
of secret powers to=
 NEAT that we are shielding from the public.  I
have no idea why it would b=
e in our interest to do that, but your
world view seems to involve mad scie=
ntists secretly scheming
mega-powerful technologies in their underground la=
boratories.  I only
wish it were so exciting.

I don't even know what claim=
s you are referring to when you talk about
"my claims."  Perhaps you can qu=
ote these claims directly so I know
what claims you're talking about.  In a=
ny case, if you continue with
this demeanor I will simply begin to ignore y=
ou.

ken

n,

r right to

aims.

n
